full_summary:
### Tender Notification: Refurbishment of Spillway 1 at Lachine Canal National Historic Site

**Reference:** PW-23-01021552

**Publication Date:** January 24, 2023

**Closing Date for Bids:** February 16, 2023, 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)

Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to bid on the refurbishment of Spillway 1, located at the Lachine Canal National Historic Site. This tender opportunity is part of the government's efforts to maintain and preserve national heritage sites.

**Project Overview:**

The refurbishment project includes but is not limited to:

* Dismantling of the existing knife gates
* Dismantling of the footbridge and its support system
* Concrete resurfacing of the vertical faces of the walls adjacent to the spillway
* Concrete work to construct the spillway sill
* Replacement of the geomembrane upstream of the spillway
* Placement of riprap downstream of the spillway

**Tender Details:**

* Contract Value: Estimated to be between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000 (inclusive of taxes)
* Contract Duration: Performance of work must be completed by May 17, 2024
* Submission Method: Electronic bids via email and facsimile only will be accepted; however, please note that bid documents must be sent as attachments to the email; emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted.

**Security Requirements:**

No security requirement is associated with this tender.

**Optional Site Visit:**

A site visit has been arranged for February 1, 2023, at 1:30 PM (Eastern Time). Interested bidders must communicate with the contracting authority by January 31, 2023, to confirm attendance and provide the names of the persons attending.

**Enquiries:**

All technical and contractual enquiries must be submitted to the contracting authority in writing at least five business days prior to the closing date for tenders.

**Tender Documents and Specifications:**

Documents can be accessed through the Government of Canada's tendering service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca). 

Please note that the tender closing date is firm, and no extensions will be granted. Late submissions will be rejected. Parks Canada retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.
